page.title: 12LOCAL ARTISTS
page.content: The Lizard Peninsula is an area noted for its natural beauty, for its sheer variety of land and seascapes, and its changing moods, from the raging winter storms to the solace of quiet days on the downs or on one of its many isolated coves. The beauty and variety of its scenery attracts artists throughout the year.{The Coverack Art {Club}is ideally situated to take advantage of this diversity of scenery, and does so to the full, as can be seen at its annual summer exhibition. The exhibition is held in St. Peter's Hall, and usually runs for two weeks. The variety and quality of work exhibited is testimony to the talent and dedication of its members, who have, over the years, produced a unique pictorial record depicting the beauty, the tranquility, and the diversity of the locality.
